snippet: Reacting to concerns by NATO allies, Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta sought to clarify that American troops would not step back entirely from combat next year.
abstract: Defense Secretary Leon E Panetta, reacting to consternation among NATO allies, clarifies that American troops would not step back entirely from combat in Afghanistan in 2013 but would allow Afghan security forces a 'lead' role, in speech at NATO military headquarters in Brussels.
lead_paragraph: Reacting to concerns by NATO allies, Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta sought to clarify that American troops would not step back entirely from combat next year.

headline.seo: Panetta Says U.S. Will Keep Fighting in Afghanistan
headline.main: U.S. Will Keep Fighting as Afghans Take the Lead, Panetta Says
headline.print_headline: U.S. Will Keep Fighting as Afghans Take the Lead, Panetta Says

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
